List.Item: Welcome to the NKPatcher Settings. Here you will be able to change a few of the NKPatcher functions, the LED colour of your Xbox and the backing up or moving of your dashboard.
To exit "NKPatcher Settings" you can turn the Xbox off and on or press on the control pad. LT+RT+(BLACK)+(BACK)
This option allows you to adjust some dashboard features.
Backup, Restore or Move

This is where you can enable the dualboot dashboard feature. After you have enabled dual booting, you must place the "Alt Dashboard" in E:\Alt Dashboard" or when selecting "Enable" I will ask you if you want it setup.
I'm going to tell you how to setup your own dualboot path, so you can have your own custom "Alt Dashboard" location.

With this softmod there will be a folder called "OpenDash Dualboot.settings". Inside this this folder there is a file called "Build Dualboot.settings.bat" double click this and follow the on screen instructions. Yes its that simple.
Would you like me to install UnleashX to the Alt Dashboard location? Note: If you are using a custom "dualboot.settings" file, please select no.
UnleashX installed to \n"E:\Alt Dashboard"
Restart
Restart
Would you like me to remove the Alt Dashboard in "E" if it exists?
Alt Dashboard Removed successfully.
Setting saved. Changes will take affect on next boot.

This option is for updating the dualboot.settings file, why would I need that I hear you say. Well if you change the dashboard path and you disable the dualboot, when you enable the dualboot again your custom dashboard path will be lost. Using this option will allow you to disable and enable the dualboot without losing your custom dashboard path.

Please make sure you have FTP'ed over the new "dualboot.settings" file to "E", if you haven't, do so now. Because if it's not found this process will fail. Note: You will need to select the "Enable" option again to use these new settings.
E:\dualboot.settings not found
E:\dualboot.settings not found
Dualboot.settings has been updated.

This will restore the stock "dualboot.settings". This will overwrite any custom "dualboot.settings" file that has been updated. Note: You will need to select the "Enable" option again to use these new settings.
Dualboot.settings has been restored.
Options for change some EEPROM system settings.
Please disable the virtual eeprom

The following: 

eeprom.bin 
eeprom.cfg 
xbox info.txt 

will be placed in "E:\Backups\EEPROM".
Restart
Advanced stuff, not much else I can really say lol.
This will change the Xbox HDD key to a known set key, so that you can build new Xbox HDDs with an all 1 key. Means if you don't have the eeprom you don't need to worry.

This process will unlock your HDD, set the key to all 1s and then re-lock the HDD to the new key. Note: This is a fool proof process, but I cannot account for hardware faults or failure, so proceed at your own risk.
If you have already registered your xbox with the Insignia Setup Tool, do not change the HDD key. This will stop XBL from functioning until you restore the original HDD Key.

Item.arg2:
I read the two previous menus and I understand
what may happen if I continue.

Proceed?

List.Item:
The Master Password will be set to:
TEAMASSEMBLY

Note: Not all hard drives allow setting the master password. You will need the HDD Key to unlock these drives.
Xbox softmod tool kit
What this does is put the Xbox into a controlled error 16 state. Don't be alarmed!. This is 100% safe, as long as you don't remove anything from the real C partition.

In this mode every game is loaded under the softmod, what this means is IGR on all retail (original) games and you never need to worry about losing your softmod again, although with my softmod that's a moot point.
If you're worried just disable it and never enter this menu again. Note: this mode is enabled upon updating, upgrading or reinstalling the softmod.
Please disable the persistent softmod fist
Are you sure you would like to enable the persistent softmod?
Remember, don't mess with the real C partition or you could get error 16. Just use your xbox for games and homebrew and you will never need to worry about anything.
Last chance to say no ;)
Xbox softmod tool kit
Please enable the persistent softmod fist
Are you sure you would like to disable the persistent softmod?
In this mode your xbox will work like any other softmod out there, retail (original) games will bypass the softmod.
Xbox softmod tool kit
These will change the system language so that ingame text matches your language.
Basically all this does is remove the need for the MSDash now.

These Options Require A Restart
You can change the partition types NKPatcher will use or populate a new F or G partition with all the appropriate folders.

Default:
F takes all the space.

Patition F and G:
F - 137GB / G - takes the rest.

XBPartitioner:
Custom partition table.
This option has a mandatory restart. Would you like to continue? Note: NKPatcher Settings will reload after the reboot.
If you use Dual Booting, you will need to re-enable it after this process.
Restart
This option has a mandatory restart. Would you like to continue? Note: NKPatcher Settings will reload after the reboot.
If you use Dual Booting, you will need to re-enable it after this process.
Restart
The softmod already supports this out of the box, so you don't need to do anything if you format your "Extra Partitions" with XBPartitioner v1.3
These Options Require A Restart
Well these options will create all the folder structures you need for "Applications, Emulators, Games and Homebrew".
Folder structure created.
No F Partition found
Folder structure created.
No G Partition found
Folder structure created.
This menu displays what Xbox Kernel Font is enabled. This process is automated and is done when the softmod is installed. You can also find "Advanced Features" at the bottom of the list.
In here you can install the correct kernel font for your Xbox, or fix random crashes using the xft font delay.
These options will install the proper kernel font for your Xbox Kernel or restore the generic version.

Pros:
100% exploit boot compatibility. 

Cons:
Cannot use this HDD on another kernel version.

Pros:
Can be used on any Xbox kernel version. 

Cons:
On rare occasions can crash on or after the XLogo screen.

If you ever want to clone this HDD to another Xbox. Please restore the kernel font first, by selecting the "Restore Generic Font" option. This is only necessary if you have used the "Install Kernel Font" option.
I will need to exit nkpatcher settings for the install to get done. Changes will take effect on next reboot.
Restart
Changes will take effect on next reboot.
These Options Require A Restart
These are to be used if you are still getting random crashes at the "xlogo screen", only apply these if you have already tried the "Install Kernel Font" option.

Start at "1 delay file" and then test to see if it's still crashing. If you're still getting crashing after applying "1 delay file", then try "2 delay files" and if you're still getting crashing :/ try "3 delay files" and so on. If for some strange reason you are still crashing after all this, buy a new Xbox.

Force Progressive:

These options will change the flicker filter values for 480i and 576i video modes. Basically it reduces the flickering you see when using crt screens and reduces the soft picture on LCD screens.

Modules & UnleashX Settings.

Modules:
These are independent apps that do specific tasks.

You can add your own by placing a module (App) in "E:\NKPatcher Settings\modules"
These are the built in modules that I use to do specific tasks, really these should never be loaded manually. But it adds a menu entry lol.
These are the user modules that you the user create, to do specific tasks.
UnleashX Settings
